===Ethics by cases===
 
===Ethics by cases===
    −
By far the most common way to approach applied ethics is by resolving individual cases. This is, not coincidentally, also the way [[business]] and [[law]] tend to be taught. ''[[Casuistry]]'' is one such application of [[case-based reasoning]] to applied ethics. Almost all American states have tried to discourage dishonest practices by their public employees and elected officials by establishing <b>HI!</b>an Ethics Commission for their state.
+
By far the most common way to approach applied ethics is by resolving individual cases. This is, not coincidentally, also the way [[business]] and [[law]] tend to be taught. ''[[Casuistry]]'' is one such application of [[case-based reasoning]] to applied ethics. Almost all American states have tried to discourage dishonest practices by their public employees and elected officials by establishing an Ethics Commission for their state.
